content.description:
Start standing with left on a good side pull and right on a rounded jug. Pull on perhaps using a heel to dead point to a right handed side pull. Continue up and right on slopers to a big lock off at the lip. Best climb in the area. 

  The sit start is an obvious project. Start sitting on an edge and use a tiny crimp to navigate into the left start of Turkey. Hard.
content.location: From the falls, hike upstream on the left side of the river. The boulder is huge and is visible from the river.

content.description: Climb obvious series of huge edges to the lip. Many variations exist.
content.location: On the back side of Ride the Wild Turkey

content.description: Start matched on an obvious block. Use a seam crimp on the face to move into top notch compression moves on the arete. Work all the way up the arete to a tricky top out on gritty rock.
content.location: From the parking area, hike down the blue blazed trail to the river. Cross the river and head left following blue blazes until you reach the falls. From Pulpit falls, cross the river and head up stream to a large pool in the river. Panther Mode is on the back side of the boulder in the center of the stream. It sits right on the water.

content.description: Start on a good ledge under the roof. Make a big move to gain the shelf. Work up and right through the sloped lip to a jug at the apex of the block. Gorgeous rock but a bit sandy. Still fun to be part of the landscape nonetheless.
content.location: Go to the falls, look directly across, can't miss it.

content.description: Extremely morpho. Start with right on the arete and left on a small left facing edge. Pull on and compress, slap to a good right hand and move left to a jug. Top out direct.
content.location: Just before heading down the hill to the falls, this boulder is the obvious right leading arete compression line on the right.

content.description: Pulpit Falls in Winchester, NH offers a few high quality boulders on gritty gneiss. The rock quality isn't quite as prime as the surrounding areas, but the few climbs that are here are quite high quality. The concentration is low and there are only 3-4 boulders worth climbing. A bit more stone exists for future development.
